name: pg:backups
desc: interact with built-in backups. Without a subcommand, it lists all

params.name: --wait-interval SECONDS
params.desc: how frequently to poll (to avoid rate-limiting)

params.name: --wait-interval SECONDS
params.desc: how frequently to poll (to avoid rate-limiting)

params.name: -q, --quiet
params.desc: Hide expiration message (for use in scripts)

params.name: --at '<hour>:00 <timezone>'
params.desc: at a specific (24h clock) hour in the given timezone

subcommands.name: info BACKUP_ID
subcommands.desc: get information about a specific backup

subcommands.name: restore [[BACKUP_ID] DATABASE]
subcommands.desc: restore a backup (default latest) to a database (default DATABASE_URL)

subcommands.name: public-url BACKUP_ID
subcommands.desc: get secret but publicly accessible URL for BACKUP_ID to download it

subcommands.name: cancel [BACKUP_ID]
subcommands.desc: cancel an in-progress backup or restore (default newest)

subcommands.name: schedule DATABASE
subcommands.desc: schedule nightly backups for given database

subcommands.name: unschedule SCHEDULE
subcommands.desc: stop nightly backups on this schedule
